required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmakokinetik of Caffeine in Epiretinal Membranes After Oral Intake: a Pilot Study
clinical_study.official_title: Pharmakokinetik of Caffeine in Epiretinal Membranes After Oral Intake: a Pilot Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Vienna Institute for Research in Ocular Surgery

clinical_study.source: Vienna Institute for Research in Ocular Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: Caffeine concentrations in the vitreous Body and exzised epiretinal membranes are measured by gas-chromatography/mass spectrometry.

detailed_description.textblock: Caffeine concentrations in the vitreous Body and exzised epiretinal membranes are measured by gas-chromatography/mass spectrometry. One hour before surgery patients in the caffeine Group will receive 180mg of caffeine. in all patients vitrectomy with Membrane Peeling will be performed, due to epiretinal membranes

primary_outcome.measure: concentration of caffeine in vitreous probes and epiretinal membranes
primary_outcome.description: concentration of caffeine in the probes will be measuread by gas-chromatography/mass spectrometry

arm_group.description: 180mg of caffeine will be given orally one jour before vitrectomy with membrane peeling
no caffeine will be given before vitrectomy with membrane peeling, patients are drinking no coffee in general

intervention.description: during vitrectomy with membrane peeling a prob of the vitreous body and the excised epiretinal membrane will be harvested for gas-chromatography/mass spectrometry

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- epiretinale membrane
Exclusion Criteria:
- none

overall_official.affiliation: Vienna Institute for Research in Ocular Surgery

facility.name: Vienna Institute for Research in Ocular Surgery (VIROS), Hanusch Hospital Vienna

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Vienna Institute for Research in Ocular Surgery
responsible_party.investigator_full_name: Prim. Prof. Dr. Oliver Findl, MBA
responsible_party.investigator_title: Head of Department of Ophthalmology, Professor, MBA
